docs: Lexeme is the most basic unit of the 𝑡𝑖𝑛𝑦 lexicon and represents a single placeholder value in an arithmetic matrix.
NOTE: All bases from Base2 to Base256 are well-defined in the lexicon, but the most common are aliased for convenience.
related: See Lexeme, Digit, Binary, Ternary, Octal, Decimal, Hexadecimal, and Sexagesimal

types.name: Digit
docs: Digits are a single placeholder - if you wish to describe any abstract digit, use this interface.
